natural_language_statements: The organisation may use email addresses to answer inquiries.
datalog_actions: can_use_email(O, E, I) :- Organisation(O), EmailAddress(E), Inquiry(I), has_inquiry(O, I).

natural_language_statements: He or she also can read the information about the distribution of options.
datalog_actions: can_read(U, DI) :- User(U), DistributionInfo(DI), has_access_to(U, DI).

natural_language_statements: The director can promote an employee to be a  manager.
datalog_actions: can_promote(D, E) :- Director(D), Employee(E), is_director_of(D, E).

natural_language_statements: An employee can appoint another employee to be his advocate, and have read access to his bonus information – for example, this might be useful if he needs help from a trade union.
datalog_actions: can_read(E2, B) :- Employee(E2), BonusInfo(B), has_advocate(E1, E2), owns_bonus_info(E1, B).

natural_language_statements: The PC chair appoints the PC members.
datalog_actions: can_appoint(C, M) :- PC_Chair(C), PC_Member(M), appoints(C, M).

natural_language_statements: A PC member can resign his membership.
datalog_actions: can_resign(P, M) :- PC_Member(P), Membership(M), has_membership(P, M).

natural_language_statements: The sole counter-example shows that a student with the freedom to assign external grades is also a ta but not a faculty member.
datalog_relationships:
is_ta(S) :- Student(S).
not_faculty(S) :- Student(S).
can_assign_external_grade(S, G) :- Student(S), Grade(G), is_ta(S), not_faculty(S).
datalog_actions: assign_external_grade(S, G) :- Student(S), Grade(G), can_assign_external_grade(S, G).

natural_language_statements: The manager has the broadest access to the information, including access to personal, financial, clinical and medical information about each resident.
datalog_relationships: has_access_to(M, I) :- Manager(M), Information(I), is_about(I, R).
datalog_actions: can_access(M, R, I) :- Manager(M), Resident(R), Information(I), is_about(I, R), has_access_to(M, I).

natural_language_statements: Only the manager is allowed to delete the information about a resident but here also that right is restricted.
datalog_actions: can_delete(M, RI) :- Manager(M), ResidentInfo(RI), manages(M, R), associated_with(RI, R).

natural_language_statements: For a special purpose, access to an older medical record can be sought and obtained from the manager.
datalog_actions: can_access(U, MR) :- User(U), MedicalRecord(MR), is_older(MR), Manager(M), has_permission(M, U, MR).

natural_language_statements: Privacy laws require, however, that a person should have full access to any information stored about them (unless the well-being of a third party would be jeopardised by revealing the information).
datalog_actions: can_access(P, I) :- Person(P), Information(I), has_information(P, I), not jeopardises_third_party(I).

natural_language_statements: Only Doctors and Nurses can read patient records.
datalog_relationships: has_access(D, PR) :- Doctor(D), PatientRecord(PR). has_access(N, PR) :- Nurse(N), PatientRecord(PR).
datalog_actions: can_read(S, PR) :- has_access(S, PR).

natural_language_statements: A person, identified by his or her patient number, may read any record for which he or she is the designated patient.
datalog_actions: can_read(P, R) :- Person(P), Record(R), designated_patient(P, R).

natural_language_statements: A physician may write to any medical element for which he or she is the designated primary care physician, provided an email is sent to the patient.
datalog_actions: can_write(P, ME) :- Physician(P), MedicalElement(ME), is_primary_care_physician(P, ME), email_sent_to_patient(ME).

natural_language_statements: Owners can access their account, move funds, and review transactions.
datalog_actions: can_access(O, A) :- Owner(O), Account(A), owns(O, A). can_move_funds(O, F) :- Owner(O), Funds(F), owns(O, A). can_review_transactions(O, T) :- Owner(O), Transaction(T), owns(O, A).

natural_language_statements: Payers can use the site's bill paying function .
datalog_actions: can_use(P, B) :- Payer(P), BillPayingFunction(B), has_access(P, B).

natural_language_statements: Data Owners can transfer ownership of information to other users.
datalog_actions: can_transfer(DO, U, I) :- DataOwner(DO), User(U), Information(I), owns(DO, I).

natural_language_statements: Users who do not have access to information should not be able to determine its characteristics (file size, file name, directory path, etc.)
datalog_actions: can_determine_characteristics(U, I) :- User(U), Information(I), has_access(U, I).

natural_language_statements: All users can read from a lower classification than the one they are granted (A secret user can read an unclassified document).
datalog_relationships:
has_classification(U, UC) :- User(U), Classification(UC).
has_classification(D, DC) :- Document(D), Classification(DC).
lower_classification(DC, UC) :- Classification(DC), Classification(UC), DC < UC.
datalog_actions: can_read(U, D) :- User(U), Document(D), has_classification(U, UC), has_classification(D, DC), lower_classification(DC, UC).

natural_language_statements: All users are given read or write access to objects only of the same classification (a secret user can only read or write to a secret document).
datalog_relationships:
has_classification(U, C) :- User(U), Classification(C).
has_classification(O, C) :- Object(O), Classification(C).
datalog_actions: can_read(U, O) :- User(U), Object(O), has_classification(U, C), has_classification(O, C).

natural_language_statements: All users are given read or write access to objects only of the same classification (a secret user can only read or write to a secret document).
datalog_relationships:
has_classification(U, C) :- User(U), Classification(C).
has_classification(O, C) :- Object(O), Classification(C).
datalog_actions: can_write(U, O) :- User(U), Object(O), has_classification(U, C), has_classification(O, C).

natural_language_statements: David can assign the manager role to Alice.
datalog_relationships: can_assign(David, Alice, manager) :- Person(David), Person(Alice), Role(manager).
datalog_actions: assign_role(David, Alice, manager) :- can_assign(David, Alice, manager).

natural_language_statements: Owners can read Name.
datalog_actions: can_read(O, N) :- Owner(O), Name(N), owns(O, N).

natural_language_statements: During the submission phase, an author may submit a paper.
datalog_actions: can_submit(A, P) :- Author(A), Paper(P), is_author_of(A, P).

natural_language_statements: During the review phase, reviewer may submit a review for paper if reviewer is assigned to review paper.
datalog_actions: can_submit_review(R, P) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P), assigned_to(R, P).

natural_language_statements: During the meeting phase, reviewer can read the scores for paper if reviewer has submitted a review for paper.
datalog_actions: can_read_scores(R, P) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P), submitted_review(R, P).

natural_language_statements: In the current paper system, all the information stored about a resident is accessible to the resident by arrangement with the manager.
datalog_actions: can_access(R, I) :- Resident(R), Information(I), has_access(R, I).

natural_language_statements: For example, a user should not record and verify the same invoice.
datalog_relationships: recorded_by(U, I) :- User(U), Invoice(I). verified_by(U, I) :- User(U), Invoice(I).
datalog_actions: cannot_perform_both(U, I) :- User(U), Invoice(I), recorded_by(U, I), verified_by(U, I).

natural_language_statements: A reviewer of a paper can resign, unless he has already appointed a sub-reviewer for the paper.
datalog_relationships: assigned_to(R, P) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P). appointed_subreviewer(R, P, S) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P), SubReviewer(S).
datalog_actions: can_resign(R, P) :- Reviewer(R), Paper(P), assigned_to(R, P), not appointed_subreviewer(R, P, _).

natural_language_statements: The doctor then has temporary access to the resident’s medical records (but not to the private notes of the resident’s usual doctor).
datalog_relationships:
has_medical_record(R, MR) :- Resident(R), MedicalRecord(MR).
has_private_note(R, PN) :- Resident(R), PrivateNote(PN).
usual_doctor(R, D) :- Resident(R), Doctor(D).
datalog_actions: not can_access(D, PN) :- Doctor(D), Resident(R), PrivateNote(PN), has_private_note(R, PN), usual_doctor(R, D).

natural_language_statements: In an electronic system we can allow residents to hook into the network at any time as long as they can view only their own data and cannot make arbitrary changes.
datalog_actions: can_view(R, D) :- Resident(R), Data(D), owns(R, D).

natural_language_statements: Requests for students to Receive ExternalGrades
datalog_relationships: can_receive_external_grade(S, EG) :- Student(S), ExternalGrade(EG), requested(S, EG).
datalog_actions: receive_external_grade(S, EG) :- Student(S), ExternalGrade(EG), can_receive_external_grade(S, EG).

natural_language_statements: Their main form of access is to add progress note entries based on their observations.
datalog_actions: can_add(U, PN) :- User(U), ProgressNote(PN), has_observation(U, PN).

natural_language_statements: author(s) of a paper can not know who are the reviewers for this paper
datalog_relationships: authored_by(P, A) :- Paper(P), Author(A). assigned_reviewer(P, R) :- Paper(P), Reviewer(R).
datalog_actions: cannot_know(A, R, P) :- Author(A), Reviewer(R), Paper(P), authored_by(P, A), assigned_reviewer(P, R).

natural_language_statements: TA can view and assign InternalGrades
datalog_relationships: can_view(T, G) :- TA(T), InternalGrade(G). can_assign(T, G) :- TA(T), InternalGrade(G).
datalog_actions: view_action(T, G) :- can_view(T, G). assign_action(T, G) :- can_assign(T, G).
